head.title: PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD: CITYWIDE ; Salutes to 1998 (Hold the Champagne)

hedline.hl1: PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD: CITYWIDE ; Salutes to 1998 (Hold the Champagne)

abstract.p: Article on some of nonalcoholic events First Night New York offers to ring in new year; photo (S)

block.p: THIS Wednesday will give New Yorkers many ways to ring in 1998. First Night New York offers a nonalcoholic alternative for those hoping to remember how they rang in the new year. Some 40 events will take place from noon to 1 A.M., including salsa and mambo dancing in Grand Central Terminal, pony rides in Bryant Park and a skating party at Wollman Rink in Central Park. Those wishing further information should call (212) 922-9393.

The 15th Annual New Year's Eve Concert for Peace will be at 7:30 P.M. at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, Amsterdam Avenue and 112th Street. The artists include the New York Festival Singers and the trumpeter Jimmy Owens. The number for information is (212) 316-7540. General admission is free but $50 reserved seats can be obtained by calling (212) 662-2133.

New Year's Eve fireworks will rain down upon Brooklyn like stars falling from the winter sky (last year's show is at left). The show starts at precisely 11:59 P.M. at the northern end of the Long Meadow in Prospect Park, near Grand Army Plaza. More details are available at (718) 965-8999.
